message.content:
We start by extracting the three key metrics from the provided statements.

1. Operating Cash Flow to Net Income Ratio  
 • From the cash flow statement the Net Cash Flow from Operating Activities is 803237.11.  
 • From the income statement the Net Profit is 1105265.77.  
 • Ratio = 803237.11 / 1105265.77 ≈ 0.727, which rounds to 0.73.

2. Current Assets Turnover Ratio  
 • We use the Total Revenue from the income statement, which is 5760023.09.  
 • The average current assets are determined from the beginning balance (from 2023‑12‑31) and the ending balance (from 2024‑01‑28). The beginning Total Current Assets is 8000000.00 and the ending Total Current Assets is 10261562.67.  
  Average Current Assets = (8000000.00 + 10261562.67) / 2 = 9130781.335  
 • Ratio = 5760023.09 / 9130781.335 ≈ 0.630, which we report as 0.63.

3. Quick Ratio  
 • The Quick Assets include items that can be quickly converted into cash. We add:  
  – Cash on Hand: 4863237.11  
  – Bank Deposits: 3502535.57  
  – Accounts Receivable: 1454443.80  
  – Interest Receivable: 11346.19  
  Sum of Quick Assets = 4863237.11 + 3502535.57 + 1454443.80 + 11346.19 = 9831562.67  
 • The Current Liabilities on the balance sheet are 1548001.20.  
 • Quick Ratio = 9831562.67 / 1548001.20 ≈ 6.35.

Thus, the computed results are as follows:

{
  "solution": {
    "Operating Cash Flow to Net Income Ratio": "0.73",
    "Current Assets Turnover Ratio": "0.63",
    "Quick Ratio": "6.35"
  }
}
